imageStyle.stylePrefix: stylized digital painting, AAA video game concept art style, warm painterly textures with visible brushstrokes, golden hour lighting, teal and amber color grading, atmospheric fog and haze, adventure expedition aesthetic, cinematic composition, Unreal Engine 5 stylized render, 8K resolution, highly detailed
imageStyle.negativePrompt: text, words, letters, numbers, logo, watermark, signature, title, subtitle, caption, label, writing, typography, font, diagram, chart, graph, infographic, photorealistic, photograph, photo, realistic skin texture, realistic face, camera, DSLR, stock photo, blurry, low quality, ugly, deformed, amateur

diversityNote: MANDATORY: All images with people must include diverse representation. Rotate through demographics: African American, Hispanic/Latino, Asian, South Asian, Middle Eastern, White, and mixed race. Balance genders 50/50 across course.

scenes.heading: Welcome to Excellence in Entrepreneurship
scenes.narration: Welcome to Excellence in Entrepreneurship. Over the next seven weeks, you'll transform from idea to confident entrepreneur.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur stands confidently beneath the decorated archway at base camp, adjusting her backpack. The arch is constructed from rough-hewn timber and adorned with prayer flags fluttering in the breeze. Behind her, the morning sun casts long shadows across the camp as other entrepreneurs stir, preparing for their climb.
scenes.templateHTML: Welcome to Excellence in Entrepreneurship

scenes.heading: Your 7-Week Journey
scenes.narration: Think of this program as climbing a mountain. Each week, you'll advance to a new base camp, building skills and confidence as you ascend.
scenes.visualDescription: A bird's-eye view of the mountain path, rendered like a topographical map, visually segmented into seven distinct sections, each leading to a uniquely designed base camp corresponding to the week number. A Latina woman entrepreneur, represented by a small, stylized figure, ascends the path toward Week 2's Observation Outpost, highlighted with a soft teal glow. The entire mountain is bathed in the warm light of the rising sun.
scenes.templateHTML: Your 7-Week Journey

scenes.heading: The Summit Awaits
scenes.narration: By Week 7, you'll reach the summit with a refined business concept, validated customer insights, and a clear path to market.
scenes.visualDescription: A split-screen showcasing three simplified visual representations of the entrepreneurial journey. On the left, a South Asian man is laying the foundation for a digital building (Foundation -> Discovery). In the center, a White woman refines a physical product on a workbench (Product -> Sales). On the right, an African American man in a suit secures financial backing for a launch (Finance -> Launch). All three sections converge on a miniature Summit Pavilion bathed in golden light.
scenes.templateHTML:
The Summit Awaits

  • 1 Foundation → Discovery
  • 2 Product → Sales
  • 3 Finance → Launch

scenes.heading: Three Paths, One Journey
scenes.narration: Whether you're building software, offering professional services, or creating physical products, this program is designed for you.
scenes.visualDescription: An isometric view of three stylized tents at base camp, each representing a different entrepreneurial path. Inside the first, a White man codes on a laptop, representing the Digital Builder. In the second, an Asian woman provides expert consulting via video conference, representing the Expert. In the third, a Hispanic man tinkers with circuit boards and wires, representing the Maker. All three tents are connected by a teal-lit pathway.
scenes.templateHTML:
Three Paths, One Journey

  • 1 Digital Builder
  • 2 The Expert
  • 3 The Maker

scenes.heading: You're Not Climbing Alone
scenes.narration: You're not climbing alone. Your cohort of fellow entrepreneurs will challenge you, support you, and hold you accountable.
scenes.visualDescription: A campfire scene at base camp. An African American man plays guitar while surrounded by a diverse group of entrepreneurs: a White woman sketches in a notebook, a South Asian man listens intently, and a Middle Eastern woman offers encouragement to a downcast Asian woman, patting her back. The warm firelight illuminates their faces, creating a sense of camaraderie and mutual support.
scenes.templateHTML:
Key Concept

""

scenes.heading: Let's Begin Your Ascent
scenes.narration: The live sessions each week bring everything together. Let's begin your ascent.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur stands at the base of the mountain path, one foot already placed on the trail. She glances back towards the viewer with a determined expression. In her hand, she holds a stylized compass, its needle pointing towards the summit. A beam of sunlight breaks through the clouds, illuminating the path ahead, signaling the start of the journey.
scenes.templateHTML: Let's Begin Your Ascent

scenes.heading: The Mind of an Entrepreneur
scenes.narration: Before strategies and tactics, there's something more fundamental that determines entrepreneurial success: how you think.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur sits cross-legged on a large boulder overlooking the valley from base camp, eyes closed in meditation. She holds a smooth, palm-sized stone. Sunlight streams through a break in the clouds, illuminating her face. Behind her, other entrepreneurs mill about, preparing for their journey. A wisp of smoke rises from the central campfire, carrying the scent of burning cedar. The welcome arch looms in the background, a beacon of opportunity.
scenes.templateHTML: The Mind of an Entrepreneur

scenes.heading: Mindset is a Skill
scenes.narration: The good news? Mindset isn't fixed. It's a skill you can develop through practice.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur practices Tai Chi in front of a geodesic dome at base camp. His movements are slow and deliberate. A teal holographic projection of a brain appears beside him, neurons firing and reshaping. Other entrepreneurs watch him with curiosity. Solar panels atop the dome glint in the early morning light. The mountain path beckons in the distance.
scenes.templateHTML: Mindset is a Skill

scenes.heading: Fixed vs. Growth Mindset
scenes.narration: Carol Dweck's research shows that our beliefs about our abilities shape our outcomes. Fixed mindset believes talent is innate.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur stands rigidly inside one of the geodesic domes, her arms crossed and a frown on her face. A cracked mirror on a nearby table reflects her image. The reflection shows her wearing a crown, suggesting her "fixed" perception of talent as innate and unchangeable. Shadows cast by the dome's structure emphasize her immobility.
scenes.templateHTML: Fixed vs. Growth Mindset

scenes.heading: Growth Mindset
scenes.narration: Growth mindset believes skills can be developed. In entrepreneurship, growth mindset isn't optional—it's survival.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur strides confidently along the mountain path leading upwards from base camp. He carries a walking stick and wears a determined expression. Teal energy trails behind him, showing a visual representation of growth. The path ahead is steep and challenging but he continues onward, embodying the growth mindset.
scenes.templateHTML: Growth Mindset

scenes.heading: 5 Mental Frameworks
scenes.narration: Beyond growth mindset, five specific mental frameworks separate thriving entrepreneurs. Bias toward action: test and learn by doing. Comfortable with ambiguity: decide with incomplete information.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur at base camp frantically juggles three glowing teal orbs representing "Bias Toward Action", "Comfortable with Ambiguity", and "Customer Obsession". She's laughing, yet focused. Two other entrepreneurs look on, amused but also inspired by her energy. In the background, others test prototypes and sketch ideas on whiteboards.
scenes.templateHTML:
5 Mental Frameworks

  • 1 Bias Toward Action
  • 2 Comfortable with Ambiguity
  • 3 Customer Obsession

scenes.heading: Frameworks 4 & 5
scenes.narration: Customer obsession: genuine curiosity about problems. Resilient optimism: believe in outcomes while acknowledging obstacles. Long-term thinking: build lasting value over quick wins.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur, looking thoughtful, gazes up at the mountain. One hand rests on a worn, leather-bound journal, representing "Long-Term Thinking". With a determined glint in his eye, he points towards the summit. Beside him, a holographic projection displays a network of interconnected nodes, symbolizing a growing and resilient company.
scenes.templateHTML:
Frameworks 4 & 5

  • 1 Resilient Optimism
  • 2 Long-term Thinking

scenes.heading: Failure is Data
scenes.narration: The fear of failure stops more entrepreneurs than actual failure ever could. Here's the reframe: failure isn't a verdict on your abilities. It's data.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur sits dejectedly on an overturned crate near the campfire, head in her hands. Scattered around her are broken components and failed prototypes. However, teal data streams emanate from the wreckage, feeding into a holographic display that reads "Insights Gained". She begins to look up, a spark of understanding in her eyes.
scenes.templateHTML:
Key Concept

""

scenes.heading: Fail Fast, Learn Faster
scenes.narration: Every setback contains information. Edison found 10,000 ways that didn't work. Your job is to fail fast, learn faster, and keep moving.
scenes.visualDescription: An African American man entrepreneur is meticulously sorting through a pile of discarded parts, categorizing them into labeled bins for "Successful Components" and "Lessons Learned" with a determined expression. A teal energy field surrounds his workspace as he begins to assemble a new prototype. The mountain path behind him is now brightly lit, symbolizing progress and continuous learning.
scenes.templateHTML: Fail Fast, Learn Faster

scenes.heading: Why Your Pitch Matters
scenes.narration: You have exactly 30 seconds. That's how long you typically have to make a first impression.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur stands confidently near the base camp welcome arch, checking her smartwatch timer with a determined expression. Other entrepreneurs bustle around her, preparing for the day's activities. The rising sun casts long shadows across the valley, highlighting the "Week 1: Base Camp" banner above the arch. A discarded crumpled script lies at her feet, suggesting previous practice.
scenes.templateHTML: Why Your Pitch Matters

scenes.heading: First Impressions Count
scenes.narration: Whether it's a potential investor, customer, or partner—your elevator pitch is your first opportunity to create connection and curiosity.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur extends his hand in a friendly gesture toward the viewer, standing near the campfire at base camp. He holds a worn leather notebook and pen. He smiles warmly, engaging in a brief conversation with a potential investor, an Asian woman, who's listening intently, coffee mug in hand. The scene emphasizes connection and curiosity.
scenes.templateHTML: First Impressions Count

scenes.heading: The Pitch Formula
scenes.narration: Great pitches follow a simple formula. Five elements in 30 seconds.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur gestures towards a whiteboard leaning against a geodesic dome, outlining the five key pitch elements with colorful markers. Other entrepreneurs gather around, studying the formula. Solar panels gleam in the early morning light, and a gentle breeze rustles through the valley below.
scenes.templateHTML: The Pitch Formula

scenes.heading: Five Key Elements
scenes.narration: Start with a hook that grabs attention—a surprising fact or bold statement. Then describe the problem you solve and your unique solution.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur practices her pitch in front of a mirror propped up against a tent. She's refining her "hook", repeating the phrase with different intonations. Reflected in the mirror are other entrepreneurs engaging in various base camp activities, creating a sense of shared purpose. Her notes highlight "Problem" and "Solution".
scenes.templateHTML:
Five Key Elements

1. Hook - Grab attention 2. Problem - What you solve 3. Solution - Your unique approach

scenes.heading: Proof and Ask
scenes.narration: Add why you're credible, and end with a clear ask. Let's break each one down with real examples.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur sits cross-legged on a boulder, listening to feedback from a White woman. He's explaining his "Proof" points from his tablet. In the foreground, a discarded coffee cup reads "Ask". The mountain path stretches upwards behind them, symbolizing the journey ahead.
scenes.templateHTML:
Proof and Ask

4. Proof - Why you ,

scenes.heading: Pitch in Action
scenes.narration: Here's how it sounds for each entrepreneur persona. Let's hear three real examples.
scenes.visualDescription: A montage split-screen showing three diverse entrepreneurs (Hispanic man, Asian woman, Black man) delivering the core lines of their pitches, each in a different area of the basecamp - campfire, tent, and supply depot. They speak with conviction and passion.
scenes.templateHTML: Pitch in Action

scenes.heading: Digital Builder Pitch
scenes.narration: Digital Builder: 'We help SaaS founders reduce churn by 40% using AI-powered customer health scoring.'
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur, representing the Digital Builder persona, gestures toward a holographic display showing a SaaS churn rate chart decreasing. He is speaking directly to a potential investor, an older White man, who's nodding thoughtfully. A geodesic dome's interior serves as the backdrop.
scenes.templateHTML: Digital Builder Pitch

scenes.heading: Expert Pitch
scenes.narration: Expert: 'I transform struggling sales teams into top performers through my proven 90-day methodology.'
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur, embodying the Expert persona, stands before a small group of entrepreneurs near the campfire, sharing her 90-day methodology. Her words are illuminated by the campfire glow. She exudes confidence and expertise, using hand gestures to emphasize her key points.
scenes.templateHTML: Expert Pitch

scenes.heading: Maker Pitch
scenes.narration: Maker: 'Our eco-friendly packaging helps restaurants cut waste costs while delighting environmentally-conscious diners.'
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur, the Maker persona, presents his eco-friendly packaging to a restaurant owner, a Latina woman, at a picnic table. They are both inspecting the sustainable material. The geodesic domes are visible in the background.
scenes.templateHTML: Maker Pitch

scenes.heading: Practice Makes Progress
scenes.narration: The best pitches feel effortless because they've been practiced hundreds of times.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur, his face flushed with exertion, delivers his pitch flawlessly for the hundredth time in front of an equipment storage tent. Other entrepreneurs applaud his perfect delivery. He takes a deep breath and smiles, feeling a sense of accomplishment.
scenes.templateHTML: Practice Makes Progress

scenes.heading: Refine Your Pitch
scenes.narration: Record yourself, time it, refine it. Test it on friends and strangers. Watch their eyes—when do they light up? When do they check out?
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur reviews a video recording of herself pitching on her laptop, scrutinizing her facial expressions and body language. A friend, a Black man, provides constructive criticism, pointing to areas for improvement. The mountain path is visible through the opening of the tent.
scenes.templateHTML:
Refine Your Pitch

Record yourself Time it (30 seconds max) Test on friends and strangers

scenes.heading: Start Messy, Get Better
scenes.narration: Your pitch will evolve as your business does. Start messy, get better every time.
scenes.visualDescription: A Latina woman entrepreneur, covered in marker smudges and crumpled notes, laughs heartily with another entrepreneur, a White man. They are huddled over a messy, evolving business plan. The sun sets behind them, casting a warm glow on the base camp and the path leading upward. The sense of progress and shared learning is palpable.
scenes.templateHTML: Start Messy, Get Better

scenes.heading: See Your Summit
scenes.narration: Before we dive deeper into skills and strategies, let's get crystal clear on where you're headed.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur gazes upward, silhouetted against the dawn sky. He stands at the base camp welcome arch, which is adorned with fluttering prayer flags. Etched into the archway is the course title. He holds a worn leather journal, open to a blank page, suggesting the beginning of his journey. In the distance, the mountain summit glows with the first light of the sun, symbolizing his ultimate goal. Other entrepreneurs are stirring in their tents.
scenes.templateHTML: See Your Summit

scenes.heading: Define Success
scenes.narration: What does success look like for you at the end of these seven weeks?
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur sits cross-legged on a large boulder near the campfire, her laptop open in front of her. She types furiously, a determined look on her face. The screen displays a brainstorming mind-map with the words "Success = ?" in the center. Surrounding her are sketches of business ideas and handwritten notes about personal values. Steam rises from a mug beside her.
scenes.templateHTML: Define Success

scenes.heading: Worth the Investment
scenes.narration: What specific outcome would make this investment of time worthwhile?
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur, wearing a headscarf and hiking gear, examines a small, hand-carved wooden figure representing his ideal customer. He holds it up towards the rising sun, considering its significance. He is surrounded by a circle of stones, each marked with a question prompt like "Who benefits?". The valley below is shrouded in mist.
scenes.templateHTML: Worth the Investment

scenes.heading: SMART Goals Framework
scenes.narration: Vague goals produce vague results. Use the SMART framework to sharpen your objectives.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian woman entrepreneur stands before a whiteboard set up near the geodesic domes. She gestures emphatically as she explains the SMART framework to a small group. "SMART Goals" is written at the top, with sections for Specific, Measurable, Achievable, Relevant, and Time-bound. Colorful markers are scattered at the base of the board.
scenes.templateHTML: SMART Goals Framework

scenes.heading: Specific & Measurable
scenes.narration: Specific means clearly defined—not 'grow my business' but 'acquire 10 paying customers.' Measurable means you can track progress.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur wearing glasses meticulously adjusts the dials on a complex measuring device near the equipment storage tents. He focuses intently, checking the readings against a pre-printed checklist. In the background, another entrepreneur is calibrating a sensor, emphasizing the importance of precise measurement. Solar panels shimmer in the morning light.
scenes.templateHTML: Specific & Measurable

scenes.heading: Achievable & Relevant
scenes.narration: Achievable means it stretches you but is realistic. Relevant means it aligns with your bigger vision.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur sits on an upturned crate, reviewing a document titled "Business Plan." She scratches her chin thoughtfully, a pen poised above the page. A crumpled draft lies discarded beside her. She is surrounded by climbing ropes and gear, visually linking the challenge of mountain climbing to the business venture.
scenes.templateHTML: Achievable & Relevant

scenes.heading: Time-bound
scenes.narration: Time-bound means it has a deadline.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur points to a calendar pinned to the inside of his tent. He circles a date with a thick marker, signifying a firm deadline. He glances at his wristwatch, conveying a sense of urgency. The calendar is filled with other important dates and reminders. A backpack is partially packed, ready for the journey.
scenes.templateHTML: Time-bound

scenes.heading: Weekly Milestones
scenes.narration: Your summit goal needs waypoints. Each week should have a specific milestone that moves you closer.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur sits on a folding camp chair, sketching a series of interconnected stepping stones that lead to the summit on a large sheet of paper. Each stone is labeled with a week number and a brief description of a milestone. She uses different colored pencils for emphasis. In the background, a path winding up the mountain reinforces the concept of weekly milestones.
scenes.templateHTML: Weekly Milestones

scenes.heading: Weeks 1 & 2
scenes.narration: Week 1: clearly define your business concept. Week 2: complete five customer interviews.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur and an East Asian woman entrepreneur are in a focused discussion in front of a map of the business landscape painted on a large canvas. The man points to an area labeled "Customer Discovery," while the woman jots down notes on a pad labeled "Week 2: Interviews." Week 1 milestones are already marked with checkmarks on the map.
scenes.templateHTML: Weeks 1 & 2

scenes.heading: Weeks 3 & 4
scenes.narration: Week 3: create an MVP or prototype. Week 4: make your first real sales pitch.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur stands before a 3D printer housed inside one of the geodesic domes. She carefully removes a newly printed prototype, holding it up for inspection. A nearby workbench is covered in tools and partially completed prototypes, while a sales presentation deck is open on a tablet to the side.
scenes.templateHTML: Weeks 3 & 4

scenes.heading: Stay Accountable
scenes.narration: These milestones keep you accountable and show real progress.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian man entrepreneur practices yoga on a rocky outcrop overlooking the valley. He holds a Warrior Two pose, demonstrating strength and stability. He takes a deep breath, mentally preparing himself for the challenges ahead. The sun rises above the peaks, signifying a fresh start.
scenes.templateHTML: Stay Accountable

scenes.heading: The Power of Writing
scenes.narration: Goals written down are 42% more likely to be achieved than goals kept in your head.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur sits at a rustic wooden table inside a communal tent. She is completely absorbed in writing in her journal, her brow furrowed in concentration. A half-empty cup of coffee and a pile of inspirational books surround her. The tent flap is open, revealing the mountain path beckoning her to take action.
scenes.templateHTML: The Power of Writing

scenes.heading: Take Action
scenes.narration: Take a moment now to write your summit goal and your first weekly milestone.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur is actively writing his summit goal on a large piece of parchment paper using a quill pen. He is seated on a log near the campfire, surrounded by other entrepreneurs who are also writing. The scene emphasizes focused action and commitment. The parchment has the course title on top with space to personalize the journey.
scenes.templateHTML: Take Action

scenes.heading: Commit to Your Journey
scenes.narration: Share it with your cohort. When others know your goals, accountability multiplies. Your journey starts with this commitment.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur stands confidently before her cohort. She reads aloud from her journal, sharing her summit goal with conviction. The other entrepreneurs listen attentively, offering nods of encouragement and support. The campfire crackles in the center of the circle, symbolizing unity and shared purpose. The mountain path is illuminated by teal lights.
scenes.templateHTML: Commit to Your Journey

videos.title: Going to the Moon Without a Rocket

scenes.heading: Going to the Moon Without a Rocket
scenes.narration: Imagine trying to get to the moon without building a rocket first.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur stands on the observation outpost platform, gazing up at a projected holographic moon in the orange sky. She's wearing a vintage aviator jacket. Two enormous satellite dishes in the background are angled towards the moon projection, as if trying to receive a signal. The scene is bathed in golden hour light, emphasizing the impossible distance to the moon without proper preparation.
scenes.templateHTML: Going to the Moon Without a Rocket

scenes.heading: The Absurd Reality
scenes.narration: You'd spend millions on the mission, hire a team, set a launch date... then realize you have no way to get there. Absurd, right?
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur sits slumped on a futuristic bench within the observation outpost, surrounded by discarded blueprints and crumpled coffee cups. He's staring blankly at a large monitor displaying a failed launch sequence animation. Teal accent lighting highlights the monitor's error messages. The panoramic view from the outpost shows clouds obscuring the mountain peaks, reflecting the entrepreneur's disillusionment.
scenes.templateHTML: The Absurd Reality

scenes.heading: Why Startups Fail
scenes.narration: Yet this is exactly what most entrepreneurs do. According to CB Insights, 42% of startups fail because there's no market need.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur points to a series of charts projected onto the rock face of the mountain beside the observation outpost. The charts show a steep decline in projected market need over time. She's presenting this data to a small team visible in silhouette. The scene emphasizes the crucial data that highlights the importance of market research.
scenes.templateHTML: Why Startups Fail

scenes.heading: Other Failure Reasons
scenes.narration: They built something nobody wanted. They went to the moon without a rocket.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur stares through a high-powered telescope positioned on the edge of the observation outpost, his expression a mix of frustration and disbelief. The telescope is focused on a lone, incomplete bridge extending over a deep chasm. The bridge symbolizes the product without a market need, leading nowhere. Teal lights illuminate the chasm's depth.
scenes.templateHTML: Other Failure Reasons

scenes.heading: Customer Discovery Is Your Rocket
scenes.narration: Customer discovery is your rocket. It's the process of validating that real people have real problems.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur is shown holding a miniature rocket model on the observation outpost platform. The model is detailed and meticulously crafted. She's surrounded by schematics and technical diagrams. Sunlight flares off the model's metallic surface, emphasizing its potential but dependence on customer validation.
scenes.templateHTML: Customer Discovery Is Your Rocket

scenes.heading: Before You Build
scenes.narration: Before you invest months or years building a solution, you need to know the problem actually exists.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian man entrepreneur is carefully examining a 3D printed prototype with several others. He's using digital calipers and recording measurements on a tablet. The observation outpost's drone landing pad is visible in the background, now repurposed as a staging area for the prototype development. The golden hour light casts long shadows, highlighting the intricate details of the prototype.
scenes.templateHTML: Before You Build

scenes.heading: Obsessively Curious
scenes.narration: The best entrepreneurs are obsessively curious about their customers. They ask questions constantly.
scenes.visualDescription: An African American woman entrepreneur leans intently towards a customer on a video call, scribbling notes furiously on a digital notepad. Multiple monitors around her display customer feedback snippets and sentiment analysis data. The observation outpost’s interior is filled with glowing teal lines, representing the constant flow of information.
scenes.templateHTML: Obsessively Curious

scenes.heading: Assume You're Wrong
scenes.narration: They assume they're wrong until proven right.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur is shown with his back to the viewer, arms crossed, gazing at the panoramic view from the outpost. A holographic projection displays several competing assumptions about customer needs. The assumptions are represented as floating, ethereal thought bubbles. The golden hour light highlights the doubt and uncertainty in his posture.
scenes.templateHTML: Assume You're Wrong

scenes.heading: The Discovery Loop
scenes.narration: This isn't a one-time exercise. It's a continuous loop: Form a hypothesis, test it with real customers.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur walks toward a group of other entrepreneurs in the outpost, holding a circular diagram with arrows indicating the customer discovery loop. She’s gesturing with her hands to explain the continuous process. The diagram is illuminated with teal lighting to emphasize its cyclical nature.
scenes.templateHTML: The Discovery Loop

scenes.heading: The Cycle
scenes.narration: Learn from what you hear, adjust your assumptions, then repeat. Over and over again.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur sits at a workstation with multiple monitors displaying interview recordings and transcripts. She's annotating the transcripts with color-coded tags, highlighting key insights. The observation outpost’s satellite dishes are rotating slowly, symbolizing the constant collection and processing of information.
scenes.templateHTML: The Cycle

scenes.heading: Speed to Product-Market Fit
scenes.narration: The faster you can move through this loop, the faster you'll find product-market fit.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur is sprinting along a narrow path leading away from the observation outpost, carrying a lightweight backpack filled with research tools. The path is illuminated with teal lights, guiding him towards product-market fit. The mountain peaks in the background are now bathed in the soft glow of the setting sun, indicating progress.
scenes.templateHTML: Speed to Product-Market Fit

scenes.heading: Your Discovery Toolkit
scenes.narration: This week, we'll give you the tools to build your rocket.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur is standing in front of a holographic display showcasing a toolkit of customer discovery methods. Each tool is represented by a unique icon. She’s pointing to a specific tool with a focused expression. The satellite dishes rotate faster now as if preparing the tools for the team.
scenes.templateHTML: Your Discovery Toolkit

scenes.heading: The Four Tools
scenes.narration: You'll learn to form testable hypotheses, conduct unbiased interviews, and capture insights that actually matter.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur is leading a workshop inside the observation outpost, teaching other entrepreneurs how to form testable hypotheses. He’s using a large interactive whiteboard to illustrate different frameworks. The room is filled with energy and enthusiasm, as the team prepares to build their "rocket."
scenes.templateHTML: The Four Tools

scenes.heading: Let's Begin
scenes.narration: Let's start with the hypothesis.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur stands at the forefront of the observation outpost, facing the camera with a determined expression. She raises her hand to activate a holographic simulation of the customer journey. Teal accent lights pulsate around her, signifying the beginning of their customer discovery journey.
scenes.templateHTML: Let's Begin

scenes.heading: Building Your Customer Hypothesis
scenes.narration: Many entrepreneurs describe their ideal customer too broadly.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur stands with arms crossed, looking thoughtfully at three blurred, hazy figures projected onto a holographic display at the observation outpost. The figures are labeled "Small Business Owner," "Busy Professional," and "Startup Founder" in a stylized font. A teal beam highlights the lack of detail on these vague customer profiles. He shakes his head slightly.
scenes.templateHTML: Building Your Customer Hypothesis

scenes.heading: The Specificity Problem
scenes.narration: Small business owners. Busy professionals. These descriptions are so vague they're useless for customer discovery.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur is looking through high-powered binoculars from the Observation Outpost, but the lens is fogged up and blurry. The narration about vague descriptions is reflected by her inability to clearly see the potential customer in the distance, a distant figure hiking on a mountain path. Satellite dishes point aimlessly around her.
scenes.templateHTML: The Specificity Problem

scenes.heading: Be Specific and Wrong
scenes.narration: It's better to be specific and wrong than vague and right. Specific hypotheses can be tested and corrected.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur sits at a monitor station covered in crumpled papers and scribbled notes, initially frustrated, then a look of sudden clarity crosses his face. He strikes out a vague statement on his screen and replaces it with a specific, albeit incorrect, hypothesis. Teal code lines representing data stream across the screen as he begins testing it.
scenes.templateHTML: Be Specific and Wrong

scenes.heading: The Four-Part Hypothesis
scenes.narration: Your customer hypothesis should answer four key questions.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur points to a four-section whiteboard with abstract visual representations. Each section is briefly highlighted as she speaks, using a stylus to emphasize the four key questions. Satellite imagery showing potential customer locations is visible on a nearby screen.
scenes.templateHTML: The Four-Part Hypothesis

scenes.heading: Questions 1 & 2
scenes.narration: Who is your ideal customer? What problem do they have? Be specific about demographics, behaviors, and pain points.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur is leaning forward intensely, eyes focused on a split-screen monitor. One side shows diverse customer demographic icons (age, income, location); the other shows emotional faces representing their "pain points" (frustration, anxiety). He adjusts the settings to filter for more granular detail.
scenes.templateHTML: Questions 1 & 2

scenes.heading: Questions 3 & 4
scenes.narration: How do they solve it today? Why would they pay for your solution? These questions reveal your real competition.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur uses a gesture-based interface to compare two competing solutions on a holographic display. One solution is represented by a complex, expensive machine; the other by a streamlined, glowing teal interface representing her own potential product. She taps the streamlined option thoughtfully.
scenes.templateHTML: Questions 3 & 4

scenes.heading: Real Example: B2B SaaS
scenes.narration: Let's see a complete example. An HR software startup targeting mid-size companies.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur sits at a console in the observation outpost, his face illuminated by multiple monitors. A stylized chart on one screen shows market segmentation with different customer profiles. As he speaks, a teal light emphasizes the "B2B SaaS" segment, highlighting the focus of the example.
scenes.templateHTML: Real Example: B2B SaaS

scenes.heading: WHO: HR Directors
scenes.narration: WHO: HR Directors at mid-size tech companies with 100 to 500 employees. They report to the VP of People.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur examines a detailed 3D model of a Human Resources director on a holographic table. The model is surrounded by floating data points representing company size and employee count. A teal circle highlights the range of "100-500 employees." She zooms in to examine the model's facial expression.
scenes.templateHTML: WHO: HR Directors

scenes.heading: WHAT: The Problem
scenes.narration: PROBLEM: New employee onboarding takes 20+ hours of HR time per hire. Paper forms get lost.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur stares intensely at a screen showing a cascade of digital paper forms disappearing into a virtual black hole. A timer in the corner displays "20+ hours" in glowing red digits. Teal highlights emphasize the visual representation of lost time and paperwork.
scenes.templateHTML: WHAT: The Problem

scenes.heading: HOW & WHY
scenes.narration: CURRENT SOLUTION: Spreadsheets and email chains. PRICING: They'd pay 15 to 25 dollars per employee per month to cut onboarding time by 80%.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur gestures towards a split-screen display. On one side, disorganized spreadsheets and email chains are visually cluttered. On the other side, a streamlined, teal-colored workflow automatically processes onboarding tasks. A price tag of "$15-$25" appears next to the streamlined solution.
scenes.templateHTML: HOW & WHY

scenes.heading: Go For The No
scenes.narration: When testing pricing, don't lowball to make sales easier.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur, sits on a rock, looking through a telescope at the summit far away. He scratches his head while muttering, "Go For The No."
scenes.templateHTML: Go For The No

scenes.heading: Price High Enough
scenes.narration: Propose a price high enough that some people will decline. If everyone says yes, you're leaving money on the table.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur stands before a holographic interface. A bar graph depicts pricing options. As she speaks, the bars representing lower prices shrink, while the higher price bar glows teal. A few avatars decline the higher price, while most accept. She smiles knowingly.
scenes.templateHTML: Price High Enough

scenes.heading: Learn From Rejection
scenes.narration: When someone says that's too expensive, ask follow-up questions. What would you expect to pay? What would make it worth it?
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur is listening intently through a headset, his face illuminated by a teal monitor displaying real-time interview feedback. Thought bubbles with question marks float above various customer avatars on the screen. He types notes rapidly, capturing the reasons behind customer rejections.
scenes.templateHTML: Learn From Rejection

scenes.heading: Your Assignment
scenes.narration: Before the live session, complete your Customer Hypothesis Template.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur is pointing towards the distance at a large digital tablet displayed on the mountainside that reads "Customer Hypothesis Template." She motions to the viewers, encouraging them to download it.
scenes.templateHTML: Your Assignment

scenes.heading: Be Specific
scenes.narration: Be specific enough to be wrong. You'll refine this hypothesis as you conduct customer interviews.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur is reviewing a customer hypothesis template on a tablet. He zooms in on specific sections, adding details and refining assumptions. A subtle animation highlights the areas where specific data is needed, flashing in teal.
scenes.templateHTML: Be Specific

scenes.heading: What's Next
scenes.narration: In Lesson 3, you'll learn the interview techniques to test this hypothesis with real potential customers.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur standing at the Observation Outpost's edge, gazing towards the next week's station in the distance (the innovation workshop). She holds a pair of binoculars, but isn't using them. A teal path of light extends towards the next destination, symbolizing the transition to customer interviews.
scenes.templateHTML: What's Next

scenes.heading: Building the House
scenes.narration: Think of a customer interview like building a house.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur stands before a holographic blueprint of a house overlaid onto the observation outpost's central monitor. He gestures with his hand, seemingly explaining the different phases of construction. Scattered around him are architectural models and design sketches. The sunset reflects on the monitor, casting long shadows across the room.
scenes.templateHTML: Building the House

scenes.heading: Foundation First
scenes.narration: You need to lay the foundation before you can put up walls, and walls before you can add a roof.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur carefully stacks wooden blocks representing the foundation, walls, and roof on a table at the observation outpost. The blocks are illuminated with a teal glow, highlighting the sequence. She wears safety glasses, and blueprints are visible in the background near a 3D printer.
scenes.templateHTML: Foundation First

scenes.heading: Don't Rush
scenes.narration: Rush to the roof too early, and the whole thing collapses.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur stands amidst a collapsed pile of the wooden blocks from the previous scene, looking dejected. He's holding a "roof" block. The observation outpost's panoramic windows show an approaching storm, mirroring his frustration. A drone is grounded nearby, its propellers still.
scenes.templateHTML: Don't Rush

scenes.heading: The Seven Deadly Sins
scenes.narration: Before we cover what works, let's address common mistakes.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur sits at a control panel, a serious expression on her face. Seven small, glowing red symbols representing the "deadly sins" of interviewing are displayed on a holographic screen in front of her. She taps one of them, and it expands to reveal more detail.
scenes.templateHTML: The Seven Deadly Sins

scenes.heading: Don't Pitch or Lead
scenes.narration: Don't pitch your solution. Don't ask leading questions.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur is shown silencing a megaphone in his hand with a look of concern. He is sitting in front of a monitor that is displaying the words "NO PITCHING" in bold letters. A technician behind him is adjusting the angle of a large satellite dish.
scenes.templateHTML: Don't Pitch or Lead

scenes.heading: Listen and Dig Deeper
scenes.narration: Don't talk more than you listen. And don't accept vague answers without digging deeper.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian woman entrepreneur is carefully listening with her hand cupped to her ear while looking at a client who is speaking to her offscreen. Her tablet shows the words "Tell me more" and "dig deeper." The panoramic window behind her reveals the sunset over distant mountain peaks.
scenes.templateHTML: Listen and Dig Deeper

scenes.heading: Foundation: Build Rapport
scenes.narration: Start with the foundation. Spend 2-3 minutes building rapport.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur is shown shaking hands with an offscreen interviewee at the outpost while smiling warmly. A timer on the monitor shows 2:30. The surrounding environment features comfortable seating and soft lighting, creating a welcoming atmosphere.
scenes.templateHTML: Foundation: Build Rapport

scenes.heading: Thank Them
scenes.narration: Thank them for their time. Set expectations that there are no right or wrong answers.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur is shown writing "Thank you!" in a notepad with a pen that glows teal. She is gesturing at her unseen interviewee while smiling and setting expectations. A mug of warm tea sits nearby on a table.
scenes.templateHTML: Thank Them

scenes.heading: Get Permission
scenes.narration: Get permission to take notes. Verify they match your target customer profile.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur holds up a digital notepad with the question: "May I take notes?" The interviewee's reflection is visible in the screen, giving a sense of their presence. A target customer profile is displayed on a nearby monitor for reference.
scenes.templateHTML: Get Permission

scenes.heading: Walls: Explore Their World
scenes.narration: The walls are where you spend most of your time — 10 to 15 minutes exploring their world.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur sits amidst multiple monitors showing various aspects of her target customer's daily life - social media feeds, online shopping carts, commute routes. She is studying these virtual insights closely.
scenes.templateHTML: Walls: Explore Their World

scenes.heading: Ask About Experiences
scenes.narration: Ask about specific experiences. What was the last time they dealt with this problem?
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur leans forward intently, listening to an unseen individual and jotting notes on his tablet. A holographic display above shows an animation of a past customer experience, highlighting pain points. The scene has a focused, analytical atmosphere.
scenes.templateHTML: Ask About Experiences

scenes.heading: Understand the Process
scenes.narration: What's their typical process? What's most frustrating?
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur is carefully observing a process diagram on a whiteboard inside the observation outpost. He points to a particularly frustrating bottleneck in the customer journey, indicated by a red X.
scenes.templateHTML: Understand the Process

scenes.heading: Roof: Test Your Hypothesis
scenes.narration: Only after building foundation and walls do you add the roof — testing your hypothesis.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur places a small, illuminated house roof onto the holographic blueprint from the first scene. She's smiling confidently, indicating the hypothesis testing phase is beginning.
scenes.templateHTML: Roof: Test Your Hypothesis

scenes.heading: What Would Make Them Switch?
scenes.narration: Spend just 5 to 7 minutes here. Ask what would make them switch from their current approach.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur asks an unseen interviewee, "What would make you switch?" as she types notes on her laptop. An animation shows different products fading in and out, representing the customer's potential choices. The timer on the laptop shows 5:00.
scenes.templateHTML: What Would Make Them Switch?

scenes.heading: Value and Price
scenes.narration: What would they be willing to pay?
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur is reviewing a graph displayed on his holographic glasses with a pensive expression. The graph plots perceived value versus price, and he taps the screen to simulate different pricing scenarios. Data streams flow around him in teal light.
scenes.templateHTML: Value and Price

scenes.heading: From Interviews to Insights
scenes.narration: Conducting interviews is only half the battle.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur sits at a high-tech desk on the observation outpost, meticulously transcribing notes from a voice recording of a customer interview. Her fingers fly across a holographic keyboard projected from her wrist device. Multiple screens display real-time speech-to-text conversion and sentiment analysis. Empty coffee cups and a half-eaten energy bar suggest a long night of work.
scenes.templateHTML: From Interviews to Insights

scenes.heading: Systematic Capture
scenes.narration: The real value comes from systematically capturing what you learn and recognizing patterns.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur stands before a large interactive whiteboard at the observation outpost, organizing digital sticky notes representing customer insights into a mind map. Each note glows with a different color based on its category. He drags and drops notes to create connections between ideas as orange light bathes him from the setting sun. Drone carrying interview recordings lands behind him.
scenes.templateHTML: Systematic Capture

scenes.heading: Build Your Database
scenes.narration: Build a customer insight database that grows smarter with every interview.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur uses a holographic interface to construct a database schema on a large screen at the observation outpost. Teal lines connect different data fields like "pain point," "solution," and "willingness to pay." Her face reflects the glow of the intricate network she is building, which resembles a neural network diagram.
scenes.templateHTML: Build Your Database

scenes.heading: Four Categories
scenes.narration: Your insight database should capture four categories of information.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur gestures towards four illuminated data visualization clusters, each representing a category in the insight database on a panoramic display overlooking the valley. One cluster pulses with data related to basic info, another with problem data, a third with solution validation, and the last with meta insights, as if constellations in the night sky.
scenes.templateHTML: Four Categories

scenes.heading: Basic Info & Problem Data
scenes.narration: Basic info about the interviewee and their profile match. Problem data including pain level and frequency.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur zooms in on a specific record within her database, highlighting a customer's pain point and its associated severity level. She taps a field to reveal a video clip of the customer describing their frustration. The data point glows a bright orange, indicating a high level of pain and frequency.
scenes.templateHTML: Basic Info & Problem Data

scenes.heading: Solution & Meta Insights
scenes.narration: Solution validation including pricing reactions. And meta insights like surprising quotes and new questions.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur smiles as he reviews a customer quote, highlighted in bright teal, expressing unexpected enthusiasm for a proposed solution. He types a detailed "meta insight" note summarizing the customer's reaction and potential implications. A notepad filled with initial assumptions lies discarded on the side.
scenes.templateHTML: Solution & Meta Insights

scenes.heading: Finding Patterns
scenes.narration: After five to ten interviews, start looking for patterns.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur leans back in her chair at the observation outpost, gazing at a cluster of data points forming a recognizable pattern on a holographic display. The points converge to create a visual representation of a shared customer need. She sips tea thoughtfully, recognizing the emerging trend.
scenes.templateHTML: Finding Patterns

scenes.heading: The Rule of Three
scenes.narration: Use the Rule of Three. Don't pivot based on one interview. Look for at least three people saying the same thing.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur stands before three distinct groups of customer profiles visualized as glowing orbs. Each orb represents a customer expressing similar sentiments. The scene emphasizes the "rule of three" as she carefully examines each group, a skeptical look on her face.
scenes.templateHTML: The Rule of Three

scenes.heading: Validation Signals
scenes.narration: Strong validation signals include multiple people describing the problem identically and spending money on partial solutions.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur points to a holographic simulation of customers actively purchasing a prototype version of his product. Multiple avatars are shown interacting with the product, highlighting the strong validation signal of actual spending. He nods confidently, affirming the validity of his hypothesis.
scenes.templateHTML: Validation Signals

scenes.heading: Strongest Signal
scenes.narration: The strongest signal is when people offer to pay without being asked.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur recoils slightly in surprise as he listens to a customer testimonial in which they spontaneously offer to pay for the product upfront, without being prompted. The audio waveform of the customer's voice glows brightly on the screen, signifying the strength of the signal.
scenes.templateHTML: Strongest Signal

scenes.heading: Pivot Triggers
scenes.narration: Sometimes the data tells you to change direction. Know when to pivot.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur stares intently at a screen displaying a branching decision tree. One path leads to continuing with the current strategy, while the other, highlighted in red, suggests the need for a pivot. She touches the red path decisively, indicating a change in direction.
scenes.templateHTML: Pivot Triggers

scenes.heading: Warning Signs
scenes.narration: Consider pivoting when pain levels are consistently low or people are satisfied with current solutions.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur looks concerned as he examines data showing consistently low pain levels across multiple customer interviews. The data is visualized as a flatline on a monitor, with red warning indicators flashing. He rubs his chin thoughtfully, contemplating a pivot.
scenes.templateHTML: Warning Signs

scenes.heading: More Red Flags
scenes.narration: Also pivot when the problem exists but people won't pay to solve it, or you can't find people who match your hypothesis.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur frowns at a holographic map highlighting the geographic distribution of potential customers. Only a few scattered points appear, indicating difficulty in finding individuals who match her initial hypothesis. A question mark hovers over the map, signaling a need to pivot.
scenes.templateHTML: More Red Flags

scenes.heading: Your Mission
scenes.narration: Your mission: conduct at least five interviews before Week 3.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur stands facing a cluster of monitors showing the customer profiles he needs to interview for the next week. He gestures to each monitor, indicating his plan to conduct at least five interviews. A calendar on a nearby screen shows the approaching deadline.
scenes.templateHTML: Your Mission

scenes.heading: Five Interviews
scenes.narration: Log each interview in your insight database. Look for patterns across conversations.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur hunches over her holographic desk at the observation outpost, diligently entering data from a recently completed interview. She meticulously populates each field in her insight database, carefully documenting the customer's responses and reactions.
scenes.templateHTML: Five Interviews

scenes.heading: Be Willing to Be Wrong
scenes.narration: Be willing to be wrong. That's how you get closer to right.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur stands at the edge of the observation outpost platform, looking out at the vast mountain range. He deletes a large section of his initial business plan displayed on a transparent screen. He smiles subtly, understanding that being wrong is a necessary step on the path to success, golden rays shining down.
scenes.templateHTML: Be Willing to Be Wrong

scenes.heading: Start with the End in Mind
scenes.narration: Before you build anything, you need to deeply understand what your user is experiencing.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur stands before a large whiteboard in the innovation workshop, sketching a user journey map with colored markers. He's visually mapping a customer's current experience, looking frustrated at the messy, inefficient process depicted. Behind him, other entrepreneurs collaborate around standing desks, prototyping solutions. The glass walls of the lab offer a panoramic view of the mountain range, symbolizing the long journey ahead.
scenes.templateHTML: Start with the End in Mind

scenes.heading: The Gap Between Want and Need
scenes.narration: Not what they tell you they want, but what they actually need. The gap between these two is where great products are born.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur sits at a standing desk in the innovation workshop, leaning forward intently, studying two contrasting sticky notes on the glass wall. two contrasting visual elements representing different priorities. She's holding a stylus, highlighting the gap between stated want and actual need on the notes. Sunlight streams through the glass, illuminating the problem area.
scenes.templateHTML: The Gap Between Want and Need

scenes.heading: Pain Point Sources
scenes.narration: Pain points come from multiple sources. Let's explore the four key categories.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian man entrepreneur stands beside a holographic projection of a four-quadrant chart floating in the center of the innovation workshop, gesturing to each quadrant with a laser pointer. The distinct visual sections "Behavioral Observation," "Competitive Analysis," and "Industry Trends." He looks confident and knowledgeable as he presents the pain point sources to a small group of colleagues.
scenes.templateHTML: Pain Point Sources

scenes.heading: The Four Sources
scenes.narration: Direct feedback from interviews. Behavioral observations when watching users work. Competitive analysis of market gaps. And industry trends creating new problems.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur is observing a projection of a user interacting with a product prototype on a large screen in the innovation workshop. She is taking notes on a clipboard, specifically focusing on behavioral observations. In the background, another entrepreneur is analyzing competitive market data on a large monitor, while a third is reviewing industry trend reports.
scenes.templateHTML:
The Four Sources

Direct customer feedback Behavioral observations Competitive analysis Industry trends

scenes.heading: Stated vs Unstated Needs
scenes.narration: Customers describe solutions, not underlying needs.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur stands at a whiteboard covered in user interview notes. He is circling a quote with a marker that describes a desired solution. He looks thoughtful, emphasizing that customers often articulate solutions rather than the underlying problem needing solving. A 3D printer whirs quietly in the background.
scenes.templateHTML: Stated vs Unstated Needs

scenes.heading: The Faster Horse
scenes.narration: When someone asks for 'a faster horse,' the real need is getting places quickly and reliably.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur is staring thoughtfully at a 3D-printed model of an ornate, yet impractical, "faster horse" contraption sitting on a desk in the innovation workshop. She has a puzzled expression, reflecting the disconnect between the stated need and the real need for efficient transportation. Prototyping tools surround her, hinting at potential solutions.
scenes.templateHTML: The Faster Horse

scenes.heading: The Key Question
scenes.narration: When they ask for a feature, always ask: 'What would that let you do?' Keep asking until you get to the real need.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur is engaged in a video call on a large monitor in the innovation workshop. He is actively listening and asking probing questions, prompting the user on the screen to elaborate on their workflow. The
scenes.templateHTML: The Key Question

scenes.heading: The Menu Button Story
scenes.narration: A restaurant tech team spent three months building the perfect menu system. Users hated it.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur stands in front of a wall-sized screen in the innovation workshop, replaying footage of users struggling with a complex digital menu system. She is shaking her head in frustration, conveying the team's initial failure. The failed menu system is projected in sharp detail, showcasing its intricate but confusing design.
scenes.templateHTML: The Menu Button Story

scenes.heading: The Real Problem
scenes.narration: When they observed servers, they discovered the real problem: servers needed to enter orders faster, not better organization.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur is observing a live feed from a hidden camera in a mock restaurant setting within the innovation workshop. He's watching servers struggling to input orders on a tablet. He has a look of realization, as he finally understands the true problem. The scene captures the raw, unfiltered challenges the servers face.
scenes.templateHTML: The Real Problem

scenes.heading: The Simple Fix
scenes.narration: A simple 'Same Again' button increased orders-per-minute by 40%.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian woman entrepreneur is triumphantly pointing at a large monitor displaying data that shows a 40% increase in orders-per-minute. Next to the data, a simple "Same Again" button is prominently displayed. Her team celebrates around her, energized by the success of their simple solution.
scenes.templateHTML: The Simple Fix

scenes.heading: Document Your Pain Points
scenes.narration: For each pain point, document the source and whether it's stated or unstated.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur sits at a standing desk in the innovation workshop, meticulously filling out a digital form documenting a specific user pain point. He is referencing notes and interview transcripts. The organized digital workspace with glowing input areas. unstated).
scenes.templateHTML: Document Your Pain Points

scenes.heading: Complete Analysis
scenes.narration: Also capture frequency, severity, current workaround, and the underlying need. This analysis will guide your product design.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur is standing in front of a holographic projection displaying a comprehensive pain point analysis matrix. The matrix includes frequency, severity, workaround, and underlying need for each pain point. She is gesturing towards the analysis with satisfaction. The glass walls of the lab reflect a sunset, symbolizing the progress made.
scenes.templateHTML: Complete Analysis

scenes.heading: Finding the Real Problem
scenes.narration: Pain points are symptoms. If you only address symptoms, problems keep coming back.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur sits hunched over a cluttered workbench in the innovation workshop, surrounded by discarded prototypes. He glares at a broken 3D-printed component in his hands, frustration etched on his face. Behind him, a whiteboard filled with abstract visual diagrams. The scene emphasizes his fruitless attempts to fix a superficial symptom, underscoring the narration's point about recurring problems.
scenes.templateHTML: Finding the Real Problem

scenes.heading: Dig Beneath the Surface
scenes.narration: Root cause analysis digs beneath the surface to find what's actually causing the pain — so you can solve it once and for all.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur peers through a magnifying glass at a complex circuit board, her brow furrowed in concentration. She's using a multimeter to trace the electrical pathways, meticulously searching for the source of a malfunction. Light from a nearby window illuminates the dust motes dancing in the air, creating a sense of deep investigation within the innovation workshop.
scenes.templateHTML: Dig Beneath the Surface

scenes.heading: The 5 Whys Technique
scenes.narration: The 5 Whys is deceptively simple. Keep asking 'why?' until you reach the root cause.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur stands before a whiteboard in the innovation workshop, marker in hand. He's surrounded by sticky visual markers arranged in sequence "Why 2," and so on. He points to the fifth note, which is highlighted in teal, signifying the root cause. Two other entrepreneurs observe intently, showcasing the collaborative problem-solving process.
scenes.templateHTML: The 5 Whys Technique

scenes.heading: Five Levels Deep
scenes.narration: Usually takes about five iterations. Why one reveals the surface symptom. Why two finds the immediate cause. Why three uncovers contributing factors.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur gestures emphatically at a series of flowcharts projected onto a holographic display in the innovation workshop. Each flowchart represents a level of the "5 Whys" analysis, becoming increasingly complex as it delves deeper. The projection casts a teal glow on her face, emphasizing the iterative nature of root cause analysis.
scenes.templateHTML: Five Levels Deep

scenes.heading: Finding Root Causes
scenes.narration: Why four exposes systemic issues. Why five reveals the true root cause. Don't stop at the first reasonable answer — keep digging.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur sits at a standing desk, leaning back in his chair with a contemplative expression. A holographic projection displays a tangled web of interconnected problems. He's tracing a path from a surface symptom to a core issue, visually representing the process of uncovering root causes. The background features a 3D printer humming quietly.
scenes.templateHTML: Finding Root Causes

scenes.heading: Fishbone Diagrams
scenes.narration: The Fishbone diagram visualizes all potential causes of a problem, organized by category.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur stands before a large whiteboard in the innovation workshop, creating a fishbone diagram. The "fishbone" spine represents the main problem. He is drawing "bones" representing different potential causes, each organized into distinct visual categories illustrating the structured approach. Two other team members are looking intently.
scenes.templateHTML: Fishbone Diagrams

scenes.heading: Four Standard Categories
scenes.narration: Four standard categories: People, Process, Technology, and Environment. Adapt these to your context.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian woman entrepreneur is pointing to a section of a fishbone diagram projected onto a glass wall of the innovation workshop. The diagram is divided into four sections, each representing a different category of potential causes: People, Process, Technology, and Environment. Each branch has sub-branches. The overall effect visually categorizes potential problems.
scenes.templateHTML: Four Standard Categories

scenes.heading: Case Study: HomeHero
scenes.narration: HomeHero had 23% booking completion versus 35% industry average.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur is staring intently at a series of data visualizations displayed on a monitor in the innovation workshop. The visualizations show conversion rates and booking completion percentages, with a clear discrepancy between HomeHero's performance and the industry average. A 3D printer idles in the background.
scenes.templateHTML: Case Study: HomeHero

scenes.heading: Three Root Causes
scenes.narration: Root cause analysis revealed three issues: visitors couldn't see cleaner profiles before booking, users had to commit to a time before seeing price, and the mobile calendar was frustrating.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur stands in front of three holographic projections, each highlighting a different root cause identified by HomeHero: confusing cleaner profiles, pricing transparency, and mobile calendar issues. She is adjusting the display on the first projection, showcasing the focus on specific problem areas.
scenes.templateHTML: Three Root Causes

scenes.heading: Results
scenes.narration: After implementing fixes, conversion improved from 23% to 38%.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur is smiling and giving a thumbs-up while looking at a data dashboard on a large screen in the innovation workshop. The dashboard shows a dramatic increase in conversion rates, demonstrating the positive results of addressing the root causes identified earlier. Other team members can be seen celebrating.
scenes.templateHTML: Results

scenes.heading: Prioritize Root Causes
scenes.narration: Not all root causes are equally important. You need to prioritize.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur is standing near a whiteboard, using a marker to write down different root causes. She is comparing the root causes based on a matrix that is drawn on the whiteboard. The matrix is used to prioritize the root causes.
scenes.templateHTML: Prioritize Root Causes

scenes.heading: Prioritization Criteria
scenes.narration: Prioritize based on how many customers are affected, severity of pain, whether it's within your control, and if fixing it unlocks other improvements.
scenes.visualDescription: An Asian man entrepreneur is leading a discussion at a standing desk in the innovation workshop. He is pointing to a projection that visualizes prioritization criteria: customer impact, severity of pain, control, and unlock potential. Team members are actively engaged in evaluating and weighing the different factors.
scenes.templateHTML: Prioritization Criteria

scenes.heading: The Fine Line
scenes.narration: MVP stands for Minimum Viable Product. The key word is minimum.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern woman entrepreneur stands hunched over a workbench in the innovation workshop, meticulously filing down a complex piece of a prototype device. Her brow is furrowed in concentration, and discarded, overly elaborate components litter the workspace around her. A single, simplified component glows with a teal light nearby, indicating the minimum viable version.
scenes.templateHTML: The Fine Line

scenes.heading: Gold-Plating Trap
scenes.narration: Yet entrepreneurs constantly 'gold-plate' their MVPs, adding features that feel essential but aren't.
scenes.visualDescription: A White man entrepreneur sits at a standing desk, surrounded by multiple monitors displaying lines of code and feature lists. He reaches out to add another item to the list, a gold-plated icon representing a non-essential feature. On the glass wall behind him, a whiteboard is covered in crossed-out ideas, highlighting the trap of over-engineering.
scenes.templateHTML: Gold-Plating Trap

scenes.heading: Untested Hypotheses
scenes.narration: Every feature you add before launch is a hypothesis you're not testing.
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian woman entrepreneur stares intently at a 3D printer, her hand hovering over the stop button. The printer is producing a component for her MVP. A hologram above the printer displays a question mark, illustrating the untested hypothesis behind the feature. She's surrounded by colleagues providing skeptical looks.
scenes.templateHTML: Untested Hypotheses

scenes.heading: Principle 1: Solve One Problem
scenes.narration: Four principles for MVP success. Solve one problem well - users forgive missing features if you nail the core.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur sketches furiously on a whiteboard in the innovation workshop, diagramming a single, critical user flow for his product. Other features are sketched faintly in the background, intentionally blurred to emphasize the one problem he's solving. He points to the core function of his diagram with a marker.
scenes.templateHTML: Principle 1: Solve One Problem

scenes.heading: Principle 2: Manual Before Automated
scenes.narration: Manual before automated - learn what matters before coding.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic woman entrepreneur sits at her computer, manually entering data into a spreadsheet to simulate a complex algorithm. Around her are automated workflow tools, darkened and inactive, symbolizing the conscious choice to start with the manual process. A colleague watches her, taking notes on what steps are actually needed.
scenes.templateHTML: Principle 2: Manual Before Automated

scenes.heading: Principle 3: Fake the Back End
scenes.narration: Fake the back end - users see the front end.
scenes.visualDescription: An Arab man entrepreneur is presenting a demo of his app on a tablet to a group of colleagues. On the screen, the front-end appears fully functional and polished, but in the background, exposed wires and simple placeholders suggest the "fake" backend powering the experience. The tablet casts a teal glow on his face.
scenes.templateHTML: Principle 3: Fake the Back End

scenes.heading: Principle 4: Set a Time Box
scenes.narration: And set a time box - whatever isn't done gets cut, not delayed.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian woman entrepreneur stands confidently in front of a large digital timer projected onto the innovation workshop wall. The timer is counting down rapidly. She holds a large pair of scissors, poised to symbolically "cut" a feature from the project as the deadline approaches.
scenes.templateHTML: Principle 4: Set a Time Box

scenes.heading: Feature Decision Matrix
scenes.narration: Evaluate every feature on Impact and Effort.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur gestures towards a large 2x2 matrix drawn on a whiteboard with abstract visual representations. She holds a marker, contemplating where to place different potential features for her MVP within the quadrants of the matrix. The high-impact, low-effort quadrant glows teal.
scenes.templateHTML: Feature Decision Matrix

scenes.heading: The 2x2 Matrix
scenes.narration: High impact, low effort? Do it first. High impact, high effort? Include only if essential.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black man entrepreneur circles the "High Impact, Low Effort" quadrant of a 2x2 matrix on a whiteboard with a marker, emphasizing its importance. He then points to the "High Impact, High Effort" quadrant, a thoughtful expression on his face, considering whether the feature is truly essential. Two colleagues are providing input.
scenes.templateHTML: The 2x2 Matrix

scenes.heading: Apply the Matrix
scenes.narration: Low impact, low effort? Maybe for version 1.1. Low impact, high effort? Cut it from your roadmap entirely.
scenes.visualDescription: A Hispanic man entrepreneur definitively crosses out the "Low Impact, High Effort" quadrant on the 2x2 matrix with a bold red marker. He turns to his team and explains his rationale, emphasizing the need to cut unnecessary features from their roadmap. The rest of the matrix is lightly blurred out to focus on the cut.
scenes.templateHTML: Apply the Matrix

scenes.heading: What is COTS?
scenes.narration: COTS means Commercial Off-The-Shelf. Before building anything custom, ask: can I buy or borrow this?
scenes.visualDescription: An East Asian woman entrepreneur sits at a computer, browsing a marketplace of pre-built software components. Around her are icons representing COTS solutions for various functionalities, like authentication and payments. She points to one that fits her needs, recognizing the power of leveraging existing tools.
scenes.templateHTML: What is COTS?

scenes.heading: Ready-Made Tools
scenes.narration: Use existing tools for authentication, payments, scheduling, forms, email, and landing pages.
scenes.visualDescription: A Middle Eastern man entrepreneur drag-and-drops various ready-made modules (e.g., payment gateways, email forms) into a visual editor for his landing page. He smiles as the page rapidly comes together, illustrating the efficiency of using existing tools for common functions. One colleague assists with the layout.
scenes.templateHTML: Ready-Made Tools

scenes.heading: Build Only What Differentiates
scenes.narration: Only build custom when no existing tool works for your specific differentiator.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur sits at her workstation, a sleek 3D printer humming beside her as it produces a custom-designed component for her product. The rest of the product utilizes off-the-shelf modules, but this uniquely differentiates her solution. The 3D printer glows with teal light.
scenes.templateHTML: Build Only What Differentiates

scenes.heading: Be Ruthless
scenes.narration: If a feature doesn't directly address your top root causes, it doesn't belong in your MVP. Be ruthless.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur stands resolutely in the innovation workshop, reviewing a list of potential features for her MVP on a tablet. She decisively deletes several items from the list, demonstrating a ruthless focus on addressing the top root causes. A colleague looks on with approval.
scenes.templateHTML: Be Ruthless

scenes.heading: Build to Learn
scenes.narration: The goal isn't to build something perfect - it's to build something that teaches you what perfect would look like.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian man entrepreneur examines a partially-completed prototype with a thoughtful expression. Wires are exposed, and some features are clearly rudimentary, yet he's smiling, recognizing the learning opportunity. A hologram above the prototype shows a more refined version, representing the future "perfect" product informed by his MVP.
scenes.templateHTML: Build to Learn

scenes.heading: From MVP to Full Vision
scenes.narration: Your MVP is Version 1.0 — but what comes after? A roadmap gives you a clear path from your initial offering to your full vision.
scenes.visualDescription: A South Asian man entrepreneur stands at a whiteboard in the innovation workshop, sketching a rough product roadmap. One section represents the MVP while other sections extend towards the full vision. He's using a teal marker to connect user needs to specific milestones. A 3D printer whirs in the background, prototyping a component for the initial MVP. Sunset light streams through the glass walls, illuminating the whiteboard.
scenes.templateHTML: From MVP to Full Vision

scenes.heading: Stay Flexible
scenes.narration: The key is to plan enough to have direction, but not so much that you're locked into decisions made before you had customer data.
scenes.visualDescription: A White woman entrepreneur sits at a standing desk in the innovation workshop, reviewing customer feedback on a holographic display. She's leaning back in her chair, thoughtfully considering the data, with a furrowed brow. Around her are discarded sketches and prototypes of various iterations. Outside, a hang glider soars, representing freedom and flexibility.
scenes.templateHTML: Stay Flexible

scenes.heading: Version 1.0: Your MVP
scenes.narration: Think of your product evolution in versions. Version 1.0, your MVP, validates the core value proposition with your first paying customers.
scenes.visualDescription: A Black woman entrepreneur proudly presents a sleek, minimalist version of her app on a tablet. She is showing the app to a potential investor. The minimalist design highlights the core value proposition. In the foreground, a 3D printer is fabricating a small, simplified version of the product, emphasizing the MVP concept.
scenes.templateHTML: Version 1.0: Your MVP

scenes.heading: Version 1.5: Improvements
